p: CLP fruit rind (flavedo and albedo) was removed within 24 h of harvest and subjected to extraction as previously reported [ 23]. Briefly, the rind was minced with a knife, dried, powdered, and dispersed in a water/ethanol (50:50 v/ v) blend. After centrifugation, the supernatant was collected, ethanol was removed with a rotovapor (Buchi R 300, Buchi, Cornaredo, Italy), while water was removed by freeze-drying. A fine yellow powder was obtained, and vacuum stored until use. The chemical characterization of the extract was conducted using the powder dissolved in methanol (1:100 w/ v).
